intro: Bulbostylis classensii, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a small herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils, often in wetlands or along the edges of water bodies. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of tiny, spike-like flowers, which are wind-pollinated. Bulbostylis classensii is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
